  1. Include FooTable Base CSS

    <link href="path_to_your_css/footable.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />

  2. Include FooTable Theme CSS

    <link href="path_to_your_css/themes/footable-metro.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />

  3. Include jQuery

    <script src="http://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.9.1/jquery.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>

  4. Include FooTable jQuery Plugin

    <script src="path_to_your_js/footable.js" type="text/javascript"></script>

  5. Initialize FooTable!

    <script type="text/javascript">
	$(function () {
		$('.footable').footable();
	});
</script>

FooTable Themes

FooTable now works with Twitter Bootstrap out of the box! And if you do not include the Bootstrap CSS, FooTable will look really plain and ugly.

We decided to take this approach to allow for better CSS styling, as the FooTable styling would sometimes conflict with your website look and feel.

Base Stylesheet

There is now a base stylesheet that you should always include when using FooTable. This is the footable.css CSS file

Bootstrap

We recommend using Bootstrap together with FooTable for an awesome default table style. Just include bootstrap.css

Metro Style

If you like the metro look and feel, then also include the footable-metro.css CSS file.

Old FooTable Style

If you liked the old default FooTable style, then also include the footable-standalone.css CSS file.
